column2: Document Title: ITP-207-CIV-Guard Rail (Supply and Install)
ITP Description: Guard Rail (Supply and Install)
ITP created by: Jason Quan/Derek Collins
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Talasila
Acceptance Criteria - Only safety barrier products listed in VicRoads Road Design Note 06-04 shall be used.
○ Check design drawing for correct type of barrier, transitions and/or end connection and any additional material component requirements
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release

Acceptance Criteria - w-beam sections, both ends of posts and all plastic components of proprietary end treatments unotrusively and permanently marked in text not more than 20mm high with: name of manufacturer, batch number or date of manufacture and strength grade and base metal thickness of steel w-beams
2.3 - Obtain and submit Material Test Certificate of Compliance for the barrier systems
Reference - VicRoads Spec. Cl.708.05(b & c) AS/NZS 1594, AS1627, AS 4680 ISO/IEC 17025 a
Acceptance Criteria - Treated in accordance with AS1627- Parts 1 & 4. All test reports shall be endorsed in accordance with the AS ISO/IEC 17025 accreditation for that laboratory.
Frequency - Min 14 days prior to commencing, 1 per 1000m of material
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release
2.4 - Obtain and submit Material Test Certificate of Compliance for the barrier systems
Acceptance Criteria - W-beams and terminal sections shall comply with AS/NZS1594 Grade HA350. Steel posts and blocks shall comply with AS/NZS1594 Grade HA250.
○ Steel posts and blocks shall be manufactured from steel which meets the requirements of AS/NZS 1594 Grade HA250.
○ Terminal sections and stiffener plates shall be manufactured from steel which meets the requirements of AS/NZS 1594 Grade HA350.
Frequency - Min 14 days prior to commencing, 1 per 1000m of material
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release
2.5 - Verification of Protective treament/ galvanisation records

Acceptance Criteria - Surface preparation in accordance with AS1627 parts 1 & 4. and finished by Hot-dipped galvanizing in accordance with AS 4680 or for components of proprietary end treatments as per the manufacturer's recommendations/ requirements. All galv coatings to be smooth, adherent and free from stains, gross surface imperfections, markings, brand names and/or inclusions. Colour shall be uniform. Hot-dipped galvanized coating on bolts, nuts & washers shall comply with AS 1214
Frequency - Min 14 days prior to commencing, 1 per 1000m of material
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release
Reference - VicRoads Spec. Cl.703, Cl.708.05(g) AS1379
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete to comply with the requirements of AS 1379 and VicRoads Section 703, for either:
(i) Portland cement-based concrete, N20 strength grade, or
(ii) Geopolymer binder-based concrete, 20 MPa strength grade.
Reference - Project Spec. Cl.1190.07 IFC Drawings

Acceptance Criteria - Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all Works meet level and location requirements within the tolerances as per the table 610.463 (November 2018) / 610.473 (March/June 2019) as applicable to the element.
3.2 - Obtain approval of location and length
Reference - VicRoads Spec. Cl.708.08 IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - The required location and length of all guard fence shall be confirmed with the Superintendent.
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release
Reference - IFC Drawings, VicRoads Spec. Cl.708 .07(a & d) IFC Drawings

Acceptance Criteria - Posts shall be installed to the depth, line and spacing shown on the drawings. Ensure line and level are within tolerance: true plan position of posts ±20mm, line of w-beams from vertical profile ±10mm, w-beams from horizontal alignment ±20mm, posts from vertical ±15mm, orientation of block and /or post to w-beam +0, -15mm, dimension of holes +50, -0mm, top of bolt head relative to w-beam +5, -0mm, top of rail shall be within 25mm of level and 50mm of line. Variations from specified line and level shall not occur at a rate exceeding 15 mm in any 5 m length.
3.4 - Construct crushed rock base for maintenance strip

Acceptance Criteria - Min 75mm thick class 3 CR, min 2% crossfall away from road. All bedding material used for cast in place concrete construction works shall be in accordance with Section 812 for Class 3 Crushed Rock
Reference - VicRoads Spec. Cl.708.12a, Cl.708.5g, Cl.703.11

Acceptance Criteria - Min 75mm thick N20 grade portland cement-based concrete, finished to Class 3 crushed rock, 300mm clear of rear of post and face of w-beam, Concrete testing at 1/50m3 per day, expansion joints 200mm either side of posts. Fresh concrete to be protected from rain or other damage until hard set
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete shall be cured either by water curing,wet hessian,polyethlyene sheeting adequately sealed against moisture losses, curing compound or combination thereof.
○ Curing compounds to be in accordance with AS3799.
Frequency - no less than 7 days after concrete placement

Acceptance Criteria - Appropriately coloured delineators fastened to top of w-beam at 15m spacings, comprising flexible plastic mounting brackets fitted with 100 cm2 of Class 1A retro-reflective material, as defined in AS/NZS 1906.2
Frequency - Once, immediately following the installation and prior to any Work commencing on the members
Reference - VicRoads Spec. Cl.708.17 IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall reinstate all signs to a standard not less than the pre-existing condition and to the satisfaction of the Superintendent
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release
4.3 - Compliance Audit of Safety Barrier System Installation

Acceptance Criteria - A safety barrier compliance audit on all proprietary guard fence end treatments constructed under the Contract shall be undertaken and a report prepared by the Australian Licensed Supplier of the safety barrier system. A Certificate of Compliance(CoC) shall be provided certifying that the products have installed in accordance with the manufactures installation Manual and specifiction for each end treatment installed. A signed copy of the manufacturer’s Installation Checklist / Inspection and Test Plan as per the manufacturer’s Product and Installation Manual shall be completed and submitted to the Superintendent..
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release
4.4 - Survey data captured for as-built purposes
Reference - IFC Drawings VicRoads Spec. Cl.708
○ Tolerances as per VicRoads Specifications, Clause 708.
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed in CAMs.
Frequency - Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
Document Title: ITP-222-CIV-Calder Park Drive-Residential Fencing
ITP Description: Calder Park Drive-Residential Fencing
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Talasila
Reference: IFC Drawings, Manufacture Guidelines, Australian Standards
Acceptance Criteria - Min 20 MPa concrete to be used as per Propietry Product Guidelines.
Verifying Documents - Supplier Certificate of Compliance
Acceptance Criteria - All Steel must comply with Australian Standards.
○ Steel section sizes must be checked on site.
Method - Document review, Visual and Measure
Verifying Documents - Supplier Certificate of Compliance
Acceptance Criteria - Survey to set out the following but not limited to: existing services and post locations
○ Offset checked against the running edge prior to installation of posts.
Reference - IFC Drawings, Metroll - Colorbond - Metline
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation for post foundation must not undermine footing of existing structures.
○ Follow asset owners guidelines for work around their service.
Acceptance Criteria - All post foundations to be inspected by the site team prior to installing the posts. All foundations are to be free of water and loose material.
Acceptance Criteria - Minimim 20MPa concrete as Per Manufacture Guidelines
○ Typical Footing: Footing dimension 900mm deep, with a 200mm dia
Verifying Documents - Post and concrete dockets
Acceptance Criteria - Maximum post spacing 2365mm centres
○ Maximum post heights 2100mm above ground level. Vertical Tolerance (High Risk Areas): ±20mm from the design line.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Concrete Dockets
Acceptance Criteria - Assemble posts by screwing them back to back with 7 staggered screws.
○ 2 x Screws approxiamiately 60mm from top of post.
Acceptance Criteria - Powder coated SHS post as a corner for a neater finish. Either 50 x 50mm or 65 x 65mm for ends, corners and junctions.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Steel delivery dockts
4.8 - Installation of railing and infill sheets
Reference - IFC Drawings, Metroll - Colorbond - Metline
Acceptance Criteria - Install bottom rail once concrete has fence post foundation has set 24 hours.
○ Slide infill sheets into the bottom rail ensuring a an overlap is allowed for between each sheets.
○ Install top rail once the infill sheets are adjusted correctly.
Verifying Documents - This ITP, Steel delivery dockts
Acceptance Criteria - Where a 300mm lattice panel is used, install above top rail and fix it with 6 screws on either side to the top rail.
Acceptance Criteria - Where plinths are applicable, insert the plinth into the post at the bottom of the panel.
– Where more than one plinth is used, a 50 x 50 x 1.6mm SHS post must be used.
Acceptance Criteria - 50 mm vertical ground clearance from Ground level to bottom of railing.
Acceptance Criteria - Asbuilt survey report to be attach for the Residential Fence.

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
